alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Escambia Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 19 at 7:49AM EDT until June 19 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Alabama and northwest Florida, including the following areas, in Alabama, Baldwin Central, Baldwin Coastal, Baldwin Inland, Conecuh, Covington, Escambia, Mobile Central, Mobile Coastal and Mobile Inland. In northwest Florida, Escambia Coastal, Escambia Inland, Okaloosa Coastal, Okaloosa Inland, Santa Rosa Coastal and Santa Rosa Inland. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An active pattern will continue today and tonight. Additional rounds of showers and thunderstorms capable of producing torrential rainfall will continue to impact portions of southwest and south central Alabama, and the western Florida panhandle through this evening. Storms will be capable of producing torrential downpours, with additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts possible in a short period of time. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall could lead to flash flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
